monitoringPlanCommentData.monitoringPlanComment: DE Karn Units 3 and 4 are dual fuel fired units (i.e., they can simultaneously fire both fuel oil and pipeline natural gas).  However, ECMPS generates a critical error if more than one primary fuel is defined in the monitoring plan.  Pursuant to guidance provided by Perrin Quarles Associates in September of 2008, Consumers Energy evaluates the primary fuel on an annual basis (i.e., after each calendar year), with the primary and secondary fuels being based upon the fraction of heat input associated with each fuel type.  Based upon the 2011 calendar year analysis, the primary fuel for each of Karn 3 and 4 continues to be pipeline natural gas, while the secondary fuel for each unit continues to be oil.

3rd Quarter 2019 Emissions Monitoring Plan comments for Dan E. Karn Units 3&4The StackVision software was upgraded from version 5.4 to 6.0.33. in preparation to upgrade to version 6.8Then StackVision software version was updated from version 6.0.33. to version 6.8.

DE Karn Units 3 and 4 are dual fuel fired units (i.e., they simultaneously fire both fuel oil and pipeline natural gas).  However, ECMPS generates a critical error if more than one primary fuel is defined in the monitoring plan.  Pursuant to guidance provided by Perrin Quarles Associates in September of 2008, Consumers Energy evaluates the primary fuel on an annual basis (i.e., after each calendar year), with the primary and secondary fuels being based upon the fraction of heat input associated with each fuel type.  Based upon the 2010 calendar year analysis, the primary fuel for each of Karn 3 and 4 is being revised to pipeline natural gas, while the secondary fuel for each units is being revised to oil.
The DAHS server was upgraded and a new serial number was entered.

3rd Quarter 2019 Emissions Monitoring Plan comments for Dan E. Karn Units 3&4


The StackVision software was upgraded from version 5.4 to 6.0.33. in preparation to upgrade to version 6.8

Then StackVision software version was updated from version 6.0.33. to version 6.8.

The DAHS software (StackVision) version was upgraded from Version 2.2 to Version 2.3 during the 1st quater of 2009. The associated "Component" record has been updated to reflect the current software version number and the appropriate " QA Cert Events Data" records will be submitted to reflect the version change. Consumers Energy does not intend to assign new componet IDs for DAHS software component changes unless the manufacturer or software platform are changed.
Upgraded StackVision Server and software version.

This monitoring plan revision includes a change to the CS0009 stack material code from "Other" to "Brick".  When migrating to the ECMPS reporting platform, the material code was inappropriately listed as "Other".  The stack material has always been cement/mortar, and the material code has therefore been revised to "Brick".
